dataset.select: SELECT julian(cal.time) AS t -- Parsing of julian date is much faster than parsing a date string. , SUM (CASE WHEN r.start_time IS NOT NULL THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) / 15.0 AS c FROM (SELECT the_date + i.interval as time FROM ( SELECT the_date FROM calendar WHERE the_date >= {$from}::date AND the_date <= {$to}::date ) c, ( SELECT interval FROM day_interval WHERE is_fifteen_minute ) i ) cal LEFT JOIN ( SELECT start_time, username FROM ( SELECT start_time, username, app_name, dataset FROM request WHERE start_time >= {$from} AND start_time <= {$to} UNION ALL SELECT start_time, username, app_name, dataset FROM error WHERE start_time >= {$from} AND start_time <= {$to} ) d WHERE (app_name IS NULL OR {$1}::text IS NULL OR {$1} = app_name) AND (dataset IS NULL OR {$2}::text IS NULL OR {$2} like dataset || '%') ) r ON cal.time <= r.start_time AND cal.time + '15 minutes' > r.start_time WHERE time >= {$from} AND time <= {$to} AND (r.username IS NULL OR {$user}::text IS NULL OR r.username = {$user}) GROUP BY cal.time ORDER BY cal.time
